item.title: Screenfetch installation tutorial
item.description: This tutorial will show you how to install screenfetch, a bash information tool. It displays handy system information at login, including distro name, kernel, uptime, cpu, ram and nice distro-based artwork. The tutorial includes support for bash and zsh, for every supported linux OS (ubuntu, centos, arch, redhat, solusOS, linux mint and more.)

item.title: Better Cron env and shell control with the SHELL variable
item.description: Have better control over env variables and shell settings in cron via the SHELL variable and a few scripts.
